summary: The U.S. food supply is generally considered safe, but tens of millions of people get sick from foodborne illnesses each year. Our Q&A report examines the Food and Drug Administration's role in ensuring the safety of the nation's food. The FDA inspects domestic and foreign food facilities to try to prevent outbreaks before they occur. But it hasn't met mandated targets for these inspections since...
title: Food Safety: FDA Should Strengthen Inspection Efforts to Protect the U.S. Food Supply
